paper_abstract: The terminal Steiner tree problem (TST) consists of finding a minimum cost Steiner tree where each terminal is a leaf. We describe a factor 2 rho - rho/(3 rho - 2) approximation algorithm for the TST, where rho is the approximation factor of a given algorithm for the Steiner tree problem. Considering the current best value of rho, this improves a previous 3.10 factor to 2.52. For the TST restricted to instances where all edge costs are either 1 or 2, we improve the approximation factor from 1.60 to 1.42. (c) 2007 Elsevier B.V All rights reserved.
